intro: Eleocharis pellucida var. thermalis, commonly known as the thermal sedge, is a flowering plant native to warm regions with high humidity. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in wetland environments such as marshes and shallow water areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
